alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Borden; Dawson; Eastern Culberson County; Gaines; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Howard; Loving; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 07 at 2:18PM CDT until April 10 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 12% OR LESS, 20-FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR THE GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO PLAINS, NORTHERN PERMIAN BASIN, WESTERN LOW ROLLING PLAINS, VAN HORN AND THE HIGHWAYS 54 CORRIDOR, EASTERN CULBERSON COUNTY, AND LOVING COUNTY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 12% OR LESS, 20-FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER... * AFFECTED AREA...Gaines, Dawson, Borden, Scurry, Andrews, Martin, Howard, Mitchell, Loving, Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Lea, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor and Eastern Culberson County. * TIMING...From Saturday morning through late Saturday night. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * RFTI...4 or near critical.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Andrews; Borden; Dawson; Eastern Culberson County; Gaines; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Howard; Loving; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
